intro: Bersama gossweileri, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. It has a short stem with a single terminal flower and produces seeds in a follicle. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
